summary: This document is a chain of emails from November 2020 between Assistant U.S. Attorneys and defense attorney Glen McGorty regarding scheduling and preparation for a proffer session/interview of a client (Mr. [REDACTED]) with the FBI. The topics focus on the client's knowledge of interactions between Jeffrey Epstein and U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) employees in the Virgin Islands.

persons.name: Glen McGorty
persons.context: Managing partner at Crowell & Moring LLP representing a client (Mr. [REDACTED]) in discussions with the U.S. Attorney's Office for a proffer session regarding Jeffrey Epstein's interactions with CBP.

persons.name: Daniel Zelenko
persons.context: Federal prosecutor with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, involved in coordinating a proffer session with a witness regarding Epstein and CBP.

persons.name: Danielle Giffuni
persons.context: Federal prosecutor with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, copied on emails regarding the proffer session coordination.

persons.name: Josh Morrissey
persons.context: IT group member at Crowell & Moring LLP asked to assist with technical setup for a WebEx meeting.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the investigation; the proffer session aims to gather information about his interactions with CBP employees in the Virgin Islands.

connections.description: Attorney-prosecutor correspondence regarding scheduling and preparation for a client's proffer session.
Attorney-prosecutor correspondence; Giffuni is copied on coordination emails for the proffer session.
Colleagues and co-prosecutors in the U.S. Attorney's Office working on the Epstein investigation.
McGorty requests IT assistance from Morrissey for a WebEx meeting.
McGorty's client (Mr. [REDACTED]) is being questioned about his knowledge of Epstein, establishing an indirect connection through the legal process.

events.title: First Proffer Meeting
events.description: A previous proffer session was held between the U.S. Attorney's Office and Mr. [REDACTED], represented by Glen McGorty.

events.title: Scheduled Second Proffer Session
events.description: A planned WebEx interview where FBI agents would question Mr. [REDACTED] about Epstein's interactions with CBP employees in the Virgin Islands.

events.title: Proffer Agreement Finalized
events.description: A fully executed proffer agreement is circulated by the U.S. Attorney's Office, with agent and attorney initials added.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office was investigating potential assistance provided to Jeffrey Epstein by U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) employees in the Virgin Islands.
A witness (Mr. [REDACTED]), represented by attorney Glen McGorty, was scheduled for a proffer session to discuss his knowledge of Epstein's interactions with a specific CBP employee in Saint Thomas.
The investigation sought details on favors Epstein may have done for CBP employees, such as trips to his island, and any steps taken to help Epstein or his companions avoid normal travel processing.

The email chain shows coordination between defense counsel and prosecutors in late 2020, indicating an active investigative thread into Epstein's network and potential official corruption post-arrest.
The identity of the key witness (Mr. [REDACTED]) and the specific CBP employee are redacted throughout the correspondence.
